sentences.sentence: The Goose( 鹅 ) with the Golden Eggs
A man was lucky to have a goose( 鹅 ) that laid him a golden egg every day.
Wanting to make money even faster, he decided to kill the goose( 鹅 ) to get more gold.
But the goose( 鹅 ) had only meat inside, just like any other goose( 鹅 ).
MORAL: Want too much and lose it all.
Hera and the Peacock( 孔雀 )
The peacock( 孔雀 ) complained( 抱怨 ) to Hera, Queen of the gods,
that while the nightingale( 夜莺 ) pleased every ear with his song,
he himself no sooner opened his mouth than all the other birds laughed at( 嘲笑 ) him.
The goddess, to make him feel better, said,
“But look how large and beautiful you are! The feathers( 羽毛 ) of your neck shine like a precious( 珍贵的 ) jewel( 珠宝 ),
and you must know how all the other birds envy( 羡慕 ) the beautiful feathers( 羽毛 ) of your magnificent( 华丽的 ) tail!”
“But what is all this worth,” said the bird,
“this useless beauty, if other birds sing so much better than me?”
“Fate( 命运 ),” replied the goddess, “has given to each of us our own individual gifts—to you, beauty;
to the eagle( 鹰 ), strength; to the nightingale( 夜莺 ), song; to the swallow( 燕子 ), speed in flight( 飞翔 ).
Let each be satisfied with the gifts he has been given.”
MORAL: Accept and enjoy what you are.
Hermes and the Man Bitten by an Ant
A great storm swept( 横扫 ) over the coast of Greece( 希腊 ).
Many ships were sunk( 沉没 ), and thousands of sailors( 水手 ) were killed.
A man watching sadly from the shore( 海岸 ) said to himself,
“A few of those who died may have been truly bad men, but most of them were ordinary, innocent( 无辜的 ) people who did not deserve( 应得 ) to die.
Why do the gods care nothing for human life?”
Meanwhile( 同时 ), an ant was crawling( 爬行 ) up his leg, and bit him on the ankle( 脚踝 ).
Very angry, the man completely destroyed( 摧毁 ) the ant-hill from which the ant had come.
As he was doing so, the god Hermes appeared to him and said,
“You complain( 抱怨 ) about how the gods care nothing for human life.
But did you notice that you just killed tens of thousands of ants, even though only one of them bit you?”
MORAL: We blame( 指责 ) others’ carelessness, but never notice our own.
Hermes and the Sculptor( 雕塑家 )
Hermes was very anxious( 渴望的 ) to know what people on earth( 究竟 ) thought of him.
He disguised( 假扮 ) himself as a man and walked into a sculptor( 雕塑家 )’s studio( 工作室 ), where there were a number of statues( 雕塑 ) finished and ready for sale.
Seeing a statue( 雕塑 ) of Zeus among the rest, he asked how much it was.
“Twenty obols( 欧宝，古希腊的银币 ),” said the sculptor( 雕塑家 ).
“Is that all?” he said.
Then, pointing to one of Hera, he asked, “How much is that one?”
“That one,” was the reply, “is only ten obols.”
“And how much might you be wanting for that one over there, now?”
he continued, pointing to a statue( 雕塑 ) of himself.
“That one?” said the sculptor( 雕塑家 ); “Oh, I’ll throw him in( 免费赠送 ) for nothing if you’ll buy the other two.”
MORAL: Listeners never hear good of themselves.

article_info.previous: 在昨天的故事里，飞虫战胜了狮子之后，得意忘形地撞到了蜘蛛网上，成为了蜘蛛的食物。这个故事告诫我们不要因为一点胜利就得意忘形，洋洋自得。
article_info.share_words: Accept and enjoy what you are. We blame others' carelessness, but never notice our own.

question.cn: 在故事The Goose with the Golden Eggs中，男人在杀了鹅之后是否得到自己想要的东西？
question.en: In the story The Goose with the Golden Eggs, did the man get what he wanted after he killed the goose?

analysis: 文中提到：“He decided to kill the goose to get more gold, but the goose had only meat inside, just like any other goose.”可知最后男人并没有得到自己想要更多的金子，因此选B。

question.cn: 在故事Hera and the Peacock中，孔雀对自己的哪一方面不满意？
question.en: In the story Hera and the Peacock, what was the peacock unsatisfied with?

analysis: 文中提到：“While the nightingale pleased every ear with his song, he himself no sooner opened his mouth than all the other birds laughed at him.”他在向赫拉抱怨自己一开口就会受到嘲笑，说明他对自己的歌声不满意，因此选B。

question.cn: 在故事Hermes and the Man Bitten by an Ant中，为什么死了成千上万的水手？
question.en: In the story Hermes and the Man Bitten by an Ant, why did thousands of sailors die?

options.cn: 他们与其他国家发生战争。
options.en: They involved in a battle with another country.

options.cn: 暴风雨袭击了希腊海岸。
options.en: A great storm hit the coast of Greece.

analysis: 文中提到：“A great storm swept over the coast of Greece. Many ships were sunk, and thousands of sailor were killed.”可知，一场很大的暴风雨袭击了希腊海岸造成了成千上万的水手的死亡，因此选B。

question.cn: 在故事Hermes and the Man Bitten by an Ant中，男人被蚂蚁咬了之后做了什么？
question.en: In the story Hermes and the Man Bitten by an Ant, what did the man do after being bitten by an ant?

analysis: 文中提到：“Very angry, the man completely destroyed the ant-hill from which the ant had come.”可知，生气的男人摧毁了整个蚁穴，正确答案为C。

question.en: How much was the statue of Hermes himself?

options.en: For free if you bought other statues.

analysis: 文中提到：“‘And how much might you be wanting for that one over there, now?’he continued, pointing to a statue of himself. . .  ‘Oh, I’ll throw him in for nothing if you’ll buy the other two.’”由此可知是免费随其他雕像附送的，因此本题选C。

share_title: 100天读完3本英文书，今天是第14天
